setting.name: System Info - Manufacturer
setting.desc: Reads the name of the system manufacturer.

setting.name: System Info - Product Name
setting.desc: Read or modify the "Machine Level VPD", "Machine type and model." This setting should only be modified in the event that it is incorrect due to service action or replacement parts installed.

setting.name: System Info - Marketing Name
setting.desc: Read or modify the Product Identifier in VPD.

setting.name: System Info - Marketing Name
setting.desc: This setting extends from SysInfoProdIdentifier, which will fully sync with Production Name in VPD.

setting.name: System Info - Version
setting.desc: Reads the Machine VPD Version information.

setting.name: System Info - Serial Number
setting.desc: Read or modify the "Machine Level VPD", "Serial number." This setting should only be modified in the event that it is incorrect due to service action or replacement parts installed.

setting.name: System Info - UUID
setting.desc: Read or modify the "Machine Level VPD", Universally Unique Identifier ("UUID"). This setting should only be modified in the event that it is incorrect due to service action or replacement parts installed.

setting.name: System Info - UDI
setting.desc: Read or modify the Unique Device Identifier ("UDI"). This setting should only be modified in the event that it is incorrect due to service action or replacement parts installed.

setting.name: System Info - SKU Number
setting.desc: Reads the System Product ID or Purchase Order Number.

setting.name: Base Board Info - Product Name
setting.desc: Reads the Baseboard Product Name.

setting.name: Base Board Info - Version
setting.desc: Reads the Baseboard Version information.

setting.name: Base Board Info - Serial Number
setting.desc: Reads the Baseboard Serial Number.

setting.name: Base Board Info - Asset Tag
setting.desc: Reads the Baseboard Asset Tag.

setting.name: System Enclosure - Manufacturer
setting.desc: Reads the System Enclosure Manufacturer name.

setting.name: System Enclosure - Version
setting.desc: Reads the System Enclosure Version information.

setting.name: System Enclosure - Serial Number
setting.desc: Reads the System Enclosure Serial Number from Vital Product Data.

setting.name: System Enclosure - Asset Tag
setting.desc: Read or modify the the System Enclosure Asset Tag. This is an end-user assigned asset tag string which is stored in non-volatile flash storage on the system.

setting.name: IMM Build ID
setting.desc: Reads the IMM Version String from Vital Product Data.

setting.name: CRTM Primary Build ID
setting.desc: Reads the CRTM Primary Version String from Vital Product Data.

setting.name: DSA Build ID
setting.desc: Reads the DSA Version String from Vital Product Data.

setting.name: Base Board Info - Product Name
setting.desc: CPU Base Board Product Name

setting.name: Base Board Info - Version
setting.desc: CPU Base Board Version

setting.name: Base Board Info - Serial Number
setting.desc: CPU Base Board Serial Number

setting.name: Base Board Info - Asset Tag
setting.desc: CPU Base Board Asset Tag

setting.name: OEM VPD Flag
setting.desc: Use to indicate the presence of valid data in the OEM block's equivalent VPD fields.

setting.name: System Info - Product Name - Label
setting.desc: Read or modify the label field for "Machine Type-Model" of OEM VPD.

setting.name: System Info - Serial Number - Label
setting.desc: Read or modify the label field for "Machine Serial number" of OEM VPD.

setting.name: Base Board Info - Product Name - Label
setting.desc: Read or modify the label field for "Component Part Number"(Baseboard Product Name) of OEM VPD.

setting.name: Base Board Info - Serial Number - Label
setting.desc: Read or modify the label field for "Component Serial Number"(Baseboard Serial Number) of OEM VPD.

setting.name: System Enclosure - Asset Tag - Label
setting.desc: Read or modify the label field for "System Enclosure Asset ID" of OEM VPD.

setting.name: System Info - Manufacturer - Label
setting.desc: Read or modify the label field for "System Manufacturer ID" of OEM VPD.

setting.name: System Info - Version - Label
setting.desc: Reads or modify the label field for "Hardware Revision Level" of OEM VPD.

config.name: Network Boot Configuration
config.desc: Configure the network boot parameters.

setting.name: MAC Address
setting.desc: MAC Address

setting.name: UEFI PXE Mode
setting.desc: Enable/Disable NIC to include or skip boot attempt during generic PXE Network boot. For Legacy mode, Enable/Disable Option Rom from 'Devices and I/O Ports' menu. Network Driver in 'Network Device List' may also require configuration. 'System Boot Mode' may further impact PXE.

setting.name: Legacy PXE Mode
setting.desc: Enable/Disable NIC to include or skip boot attempt during generic PXE Network boot. For Legacy mode, Enable/Disable Option Rom from 'Devices and I/O Ports' menu. Network Driver in 'Network Device List' may also require configuration. 'System Boot Mode' may further impact PXE.

setting.name: PXE Internet Protocol
setting.desc: IPv4, IPv6, or attempt IPv6 then IPv4

config.name: Advanced RAS
config.desc: Choose whether to enable various advanced RAS options.

setting.name: Machine Check Recovery
setting.desc: Select whether to enable Machine Check Recovery.

setting.name: PCI Live Error Recovery
setting.desc: Select whether to enable PCI Live Error Recovery.

setting.name: PCIe Isolation
setting.desc: Select whether to enable PCIe Isolation.

setting.name: Hardware Memory Dump
setting.desc: Select whether to enable Hardware Memory Dump

setting.name: Post Process
setting.desc: Select action at completion of Hardware Memory Dump.

config.name: Trusted Computing Group
config.desc: Trusted Computing Group.

setting.name: Device Status

text_data.instance: TPM1.2 Device is Enabled and Activated, ownership is not installed, Hardware Physical Presence is Deasserted.

setting.desc: Display the Device Status and Physical Presence Status

setting.name: Device Operation
setting.desc: TPM1.2 Device Operation Request

config.name: POST Attempts
config.desc: Configure the number of attempts to POST, before recovery mechanisms are to be invoked.

setting.name: POST Attempts Limit
setting.desc: Enter the number of consecutive failed POST attempts allowed before invoking recovery mechanisms.

config.name: Disk GPT Recovery
config.desc: Disk GPT (GUID Partition Table) Recovery Options.

setting.name: Disk GPT Recovery
setting.desc:
When <Automatic> is selected UEFI will attempt to repair a corrupted GUID Partition Table (GPT) by copying the non-corrupt version over the invalid one. A message will then be logged to the System Event Log to indicate the status of the repair.
When <Manual> is selected UEFI will prompt the user before taking any action. The user will have an opportunity to decide if repair action should be taken. A message will be logged to the EventLog to indicate the corruption found and if repair action was taken then the repair results.
With <None> selected no attempt will be made by UEFI to recover a corrupted GPT, a message will be logged to the EventLog and the system will continue to POST. However, if the remaining valid GPT becomes corrupt, the disk will no longer be accessible.

config.name: Operating Modes
config.desc: Select the operating mode desired based on your preference. Note, power savings and performance are also highly dependent on hardware configuration and the software running on the system.”

setting.name: Choose Operating Mode
setting.desc: Select the operating mode based on your preference. Power savings and performance are also highly dependent on hardware and software running on the system. The selected operating mode will automatically change low-level settings per the mode selected and will not allow them to be changed individually. Switch to Custom Mode to set low level settings individually.

config.name: Backup Bank Management
config.desc: Select this option to configure backup bank management settings.

setting.name: Backup Bank Management Method
setting.desc: When Auto Promotion is selected, the IMM will automatically update the backup bank after the specified number of weeks and successful consecutive boots have been passed. When set to User Managed, the IMM will not automatically update the backup bank.

setting.name: Number Of Successful Consecutive Boots
setting.desc: This value is used for Auto Promotion.

setting.name: Number Of Weeks
setting.desc: This value is used for Auto Promotion.

config.name: TPM Version
config.desc: Update TPM chip firmware between TPM1.2 and TPM2.0

setting.name: TPM Version
setting.desc: Caution: when update TPM chip firmware to TPM2.0 compliant, please do not boot a legacy OS due to security consideration. Change will not take effect immediately, but need a system reboot to confirm physical presence. Note: the MAX limit count for TPM chip firmware update is 128, and TPM version cannot be updated any more if MAX limit count is reached

config.name: System Recovery
config.desc: Select this option to configure system recovery settings.

setting.name: POST Watchdog Timer
setting.desc: Select this option to Enable/Disable POST Watchdog Timer.

setting.name: POST Watchdog Timer Value
setting.desc: Enter POST loader Watchdog timer value in (5-20) minute range.

setting.name: Reboot System on NMI
setting.desc: Select this option to Enable/Disable reboot of the system during NMI.

setting.name: Halt On Severe Error
setting.desc: If a severe error is detected during POST, enabling this option will prevent the system from booting into OS and will show POST Event Viewer.

config.name: Processors
config.desc: Displays and provides option to change the Processor Settings.

setting.name: Turbo Mode
setting.desc: Enabling turbo mode can boost the overall CPU performance when all CPU cores are not being fully utilized. A CPU core can run above its rated frequency for a short period of time when it is in turbo mode.

setting.name: Processor Performance States
setting.desc: Enabling processor performance states (Intel Speedstep Technology) saves power by reducing speed and voltage as the CPU utilized is reduced. Note, some OSes must have the correct power profile selected to take advantage of this feature.

setting.name: C-States
setting.desc: Enabling C-states allows the OS to place the CPUs into lower power states when idle. The ACPI C-state limit menu can be used to restrict the available C-states.

setting.name: Package ACPI C-State Limit
setting.desc: Selecting a higher C-state limit allows the CPUs to consume less power when they are idle. If you experience problems with legacy OSes, set the ACPI C-state limit to C2.

setting.name: C1 Enhanced Mode
setting.desc: Enabling C1E (C1 enhanced) state can save power by halting CPU cores that are idle. Note, an operating system that supports C1E state must be installed to take advantage of this feature. Changing this setting takes affect after the next reboot.

setting.name: Hyper-Threading
setting.desc: Enables Hyper Threading (Software Method to Enable/Disable Logical Processor threads).

setting.name: Execute Disable Bit
setting.desc: When disabled, forces the XD feature flag to always return 0.

setting.name: Intel Virtualization Technology
setting.desc: Enables the Vanderpool Technology, takes effect after reboot.

setting.name: Enable SMX
setting.desc: Enables Safer Mode Extensions.

setting.name: Hardware Prefetcher
setting.desc: Lightly threaded applications and some benchmarks can benefit from having the hardware prefetcher enabled.

setting.name: Adjacent Cache Prefetch
setting.desc: Lightly threaded applications and some benchmarks can benefit from having the adjacent cache line prefetch enabled.

setting.name: DCU Streamer Prefetcher
setting.desc: Lightly threaded applications and some benchmarks can benefit from having the DCU streamer prefetcher enabled.

setting.name: DCU IP Prefetcher
setting.desc: DCU IP prefetcher is typically best left enabled for most environments. Some environments may benefit from having it disabled (e.g. Java).

setting.name: Direct Cache Access (DCA)
setting.desc: DCA capable I/O devices such as network controllers can place data directly into the CPU cache, which improves response times.

setting.name: AES-NI
setting.desc: Enable/disable AES-NI support

setting.name: MWAIT/MMONITOR
setting.desc: MONITOR/MWAIT instructions are used to engage C-states. Some operating systems will re-enable C-states even when they are disabled in CMOS. To prevent this, disable MONNITOR/MWAIT

setting.name: Cores in CPU Package
setting.desc: Select the amount of cores enabled within each CPU Package.

setting.name: Max P State
setting.desc: Limits the P-state to the maximum number specified. (P0=fastest, Pn=slowest frequency)

setting.name: Intel® Processor Uncore Devices
setting.desc: Warning, for test purposes ONLY: Hide/Unhide Intel® Processor Uncore devices that reside on the PCI bus assigned for the processor socket. Some 3rd party analysis tools need access to these device registers in order to work properly. This option should be set to Disable.

setting.name: QPI Link Frequency
setting.desc: Select the desired CPU QPI link frequency. Maximum Performance mode maximizes performance. Balanced mode offers a balance between performance and power. Minimal power maximizes power savings.

setting.name: Energy Efficient Turbo
setting.desc: When energy efficient turbo is enabled, the CPU's optimal turbo frequency will be tuned dynamically based on CPU utilization. The power/performance bias setting also influences energy efficient turbo.

setting.name: Uncore Frequency Scaling
setting.desc: When enabled, the CPU uncore will dynamically change speed based on the workload. All miscellaneous logic inside the CPU package is considered the uncore.

setting.name: Uncore Frequency
setting.desc: Max Uncore Frequency

setting.name: Per Core P-state
setting.desc: When per-core P-states are enabled, each physical CPU core can operate at separate frequencies. If disabled, all cores in a package will operate at the highest resolved frequency of all active threads. If minimum variability is desired, disable per core P-states.

setting.name: CPU Frequency Limits
setting.desc: The maximum turbo frequency can be restricted with turbo limiting to a frequency that is between the maximum turbo frequency and the rated frequency for the CPU installed. This can useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max turbo frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If the turbo limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (full turbo uplift).

setting.name: DisableProcessor
setting.desc: Disables 2 Processors in a system. For 4 Socket system, Socket 3 and 4 are disabled. For 8 Socket system, Socket 7 and 8 are disabled. To disable 4 Processors on 8S system, just unpartion the systemFor 8 Socket system, just unpartition the system.

setting.name: 1 core active
setting.desc: The maximum frequency (turbo, AVX, and non turbo) can be restricted to a frequency that is between the maximum turbo frequency for the CPU installed and 1.2GHz. This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

setting.name: 2 cores active
setting.desc: The maximum frequency (turbo, AVX, and non turbo) can be restricted to a frequency that is between the maximum turbo frequency for the CPU installed and 1.2GHz. This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

setting.name: 3 cores active
setting.desc: The maximum frequency (turbo, AVX, and non turbo) can be restricted to a frequency that is between the maximum turbo frequency for the CPU installed and 1.2GHz. This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

setting.name: 4 cores active
setting.desc: The maximum frequency (turbo, AVX, and non turbo) can be restricted to a frequency that is between the maximum turbo frequency for the CPU installed and 1.2GHz. This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

setting.name: 5 cores active
setting.desc: The maximum frequency (turbo, AVX, and non turbo) can be restricted to a frequency that is between the maximum turbo frequency for the CPU installed and 1.2GHz. This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

setting.name: 6 cores active

If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

setting.name: 12 cores active

This can be useful for synchronizing CPU tasks. Note, the max frequency for N+1 cores cannot be higher than N cores. If an illegal frequency is entered, it will automatically be limited to a legal value. If the CPU frequency limits are being controlled through application software, leave this menu item at the default (maximum turbo uplift).

config.name: Power
config.desc: Press <Enter> to see Power Scheme Options.

setting.name: Active Energy Manager
setting.desc: Select this choice to enable or disable AEM Power Capping. When Power Capping is enabled, AEM application can limit the maximum power consumed by this system.

setting.name: Power/Performance Bias
setting.desc: Power/Performance bias determines how aggressively the CPU will be power managed and placed into turbo. With Platform Controlled, the system controls the setting. Selecting OS Controlled allows the operating system to control it. Not all OSes support this feature.

setting.name: Platform Controlled Type
setting.desc: Maximum Performance allows the most aggressive use of turbo and power management functions are disabled, thereby increasing power consumption. Minimal Power disables turbo and maximizes the use of power management features.

setting.name: Workload Configuration
setting.desc: I/O sensitive should be used with expansion cards that require high I/O bandwidth when the CPU cores are idle to allow enough frequency for the workload.

setting.name: SharedMezzFlag
setting.desc: SharedMezzFlag

setting.name: MezzPresenceFlag
setting.desc: MezzPresenceFlag

setting.name: 10Gb Mezz Card Standby Power
setting.desc: When this choice is enabled, system fans keep running when off. If disabled, system saves more power when off but loses network connection on 10Gb Mezz card which affects Wake On Lan and shared System Management ethernet port functions.

setting.name: ACPI Fixed Power Button
setting.desc: Enable/Disable ACPI Fixed Power Button. When disabled physically pressing the power button on front of the system won't execute the Operating System's Power Button Policy such as shutdown, turn off monitor, etc. Also, when disabled the 'Shut down OS and ..." options under the iMM Server Power Actions feature will be disabled.

config.name: Devices and I/O Ports
config.desc: Press <Enter> to see planar devices and I/O Port Options.

setting.name: Active Video
setting.desc: If Add-in Device is selected, video will be switched from onboard video to an add-in video adapter, and the onboard video will be disabled before booting into OS. If Onboard Device is selected, an add-in video adapter can be used as the secondary video.

setting.name: PCI 64-Bit Resource Allocation
setting.desc: Enable or disable the allocation of 64-bit resources for PCI

setting.name: MM Config Base
setting.desc: Select the Memory Mapped Config Space base address

setting.name: Intel® VT for Directed I/O (VT-d)
setting.desc: Enable/Disable Intel® Virtualization Technology for Directed I/O (VT-d) by reporting the I/O device assignment to VMM through DMAR ACPI Tables.

setting.name: Snoop Response Hold Off
setting.desc: Sets Snoop Response Hold Off value, 256 cycles as Default

setting.name: Set Option ROM Execution Order
setting.desc: Select the load order for legacy PCI option ROM(s). NOTE: This order may be overridden for devices controlled by UEFI thunk drivers.

setting.name: COM Port 1
setting.desc: This is an advanced setting. Please modify with care as several options below will not work correctly.

setting.name: COM Port 2
setting.desc: This is an advanced setting. Please modify with care as several options below will not work correctly.

setting.name: Remote Console
setting.desc: Set your Remote Console redirection preference. Auto would detect ipmi status to determine whether open Remote Console redireciton. Enable this option for SOL functionality.

setting.name: Serial Port Sharing
setting.desc: Set your IPMI status.

setting.name: Serial Port Access Mode
setting.desc: Set your access mode.

setting.name: SP Redirection
setting.desc: Set your SP Redirection status.

setting.name: Legacy Option ROM Display
setting.desc: Select which serial port will be used for legacy.

setting.name: Com1 Baud Rate
setting.desc: Set your Baud Rate.

setting.name: Com1 Data Bits
setting.desc: Set your Data bits.

setting.name: Com1 Parity
setting.desc: Set your Parity.

setting.name: Com1 Stop Bits
setting.desc: Set your Stop Bits.

setting.name: Com1 Terminal Emulation
setting.desc: Set your Terminal Emulation.

setting.name: Com1 Active After Boot
setting.desc: Active after boot Settings.

setting.name: Com1 Flow Control
setting.desc: Flow Control Settings.

setting.name: Com2 Baud Rate
setting.desc: Set your Baud Rate.

setting.name: Com2 Data Bits
setting.desc: Set your Data bits.

setting.name: Com2 Parity
setting.desc: Set your Parity.

setting.name: Com2 Stop Bits
setting.desc: Set your Stop Bits.

setting.name: Com2 Terminal Emulation
setting.desc: Set your Terminal Emulation.

setting.name: Com2 Active After Boot
setting.desc: Active after boot Settings.

setting.name: Com2 Flow Control
setting.desc: Flow Control Settings.

setting.name: USB Ports Per-Port Disable Control
setting.desc: Control each of the USB ports (0~13) disabling.

setting.name: USB Port #0 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #1 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #2 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #3 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #4 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #5 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #6 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #7 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #8 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #9 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #10 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #11 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #12 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.name: USB Port #13 Disable
setting.desc: Disable USB port.

setting.desc: Disabling an entry will prevent the system from executing any legacy PCI option ROM(s) associated with the device.

setting.name: UEFI_Video
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_USB 3.0
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 1
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 9
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 10 (ML2)
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 11 (Sec Storage)
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 12 (Pri Storage)
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 16
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 17
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 18
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: UEFI_Slot 19
setting.desc: Note: Disabling some UEFI OPROMs may adversely affect iSCSI and BoFM operation.

setting.name: Slot 1
setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.name: Slot 2
setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.name: Slot 3
setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.name: Slot 4
setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.name: Slot 9
setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.name: Slot 10 (ML2)
setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.name: Slot 11 (Sec Storage)
setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.name: Slot 12 (Pri Storage)
setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

setting.desc: Set the PCIe slot as Generation 1 or Generation 2 or Generation 3. Note: Some adapters may not operate correctly in Gen2 or Gen3. Make sure to power OFF and power ON the system for these settings to take effect.

config.name: Memory
config.desc: Displays and provides option to change the Memory Settings

setting.name: Memory Mode
setting.desc: Select the mode for memory initialization

setting.name: Memory Speed
setting.desc: Select the desired memory speed. Maximum performance mode maximizes performance. Balanced mode offers a balance between performance and power. Minimal power mode maximizes power savings.

setting.name: Mem Pwr Mngment Support Flag
setting.desc: Mem Pwr Mngment Support or not.

setting.name: Memory Power Management
setting.desc: Disable provides maximum performance but minimum power savings. Automatic is suitable for most applications.

setting.name: CKE Throttling
setting.desc: CKE throttling saves power on unused DIMM ranks by placing them into a low power state. ‘Disabled’ turns of the power savings feature. ‘L5: APD_ON_PPDS_ON’ saves the most power but can have the highest impact to performance depending on the application.

setting.name: CK Self Refresh
setting.desc: CK self-refresh saves power by placing idle memory channels into self-refresh. ‘L1: CK_DRIVEN’ turns off the power saving feature. ‘L4: CK_HIGH’, saves the most power but can have the highest performance impact depending on the application.

setting.name: Socket Interleave
setting.desc: Sets Socket Interleave to NUMA(Non Unified Memory Architecture) or Non-NUMA. NUMA: Memory is not interleaved across processors. Non-NUMA: Memory is interleaved across processors

setting.name: Patrol Scrub
setting.desc: Enable/Disable Patrol Scrub

setting.name: Memory Data Scrambling
setting.desc: Memory Data Scrambling Disable/Enable.

setting.name: Mirroring
setting.desc: Select whether to enable memory mirroring.

setting.name: Mirroring Type
setting.desc: Select full or partial memory mirroring.

setting.name: Sparing
setting.desc: Select whether to enable memory sparing.

setting.name: Custom Refresh Enable
setting.desc: [Disabled] will set system with 1x refresh rate; [Enable] will set 2x refresh rate. Choose refresh rate 2x to mitigate rowhammer issue, this may have a performance side effect.

setting.name: DRAM Maintenance
setting.desc: Select Manual to customize DRAM Maintenance settings

setting.name: DRAM Maintenance Mode
setting.desc: Select between pTRR and TRR mode. Choose pTRR Mode to mitigate rowhammer issue, this may have minor performance side effect.

setting.name: Rank Margining Test
setting.desc: Enable rank margining test after training for Rx DQ, Tx DQ, Rx Verf and Tx Verf.

setting.name: DDR4 Unique Identifier Feature
setting.desc: Enable/Disable DDR4 Unique Identifier Feature

setting.name: TurnOff3rdPartyStretchGoals
setting.desc: Enable/Disable 3rd Memory Party Stretch Goals

setting.name: Post Package Repair
setting.desc: Enable/Disable Post Package Repair

setting.desc: Dimm Disable Control

config.name: Legacy Support
config.desc: Settings related to (Pre-UEFI) Legacy support.

setting.name: Force Legacy Video on Boot
setting.desc: Force Int 0x10h video support: required if the OS does not support UEFI video output standards.

setting.name: Rehook INT 19h
setting.desc: Prevent devices from taking control of the boot process.

setting.name: Legacy Thunk Support
setting.desc: Enable or Disable UEFI to interact with PCI Mass storage devices that are non UEFI compliant.

setting.name: Infinite Boot Retry
setting.desc: Continuously retry the Boot Order. Please ensure a legacy boot device(i.e. PXE) is specified in Boot Sequence.

setting.name: BBS Boot
setting.desc: Legacy boot in accordance with BIOS Boot Specification (BBS).

setting.name: Non-Planar PXE
setting.desc: Enable/Disable Non-Planar PXE for legacy mode

config.name: UEFI Misc
config.desc: Provide a mechanism which could control outputting of debug info by ASU

setting.name: UEFI Misc
setting.desc: Set UEFI Misc, Bit 0 is used for controlling UCM xml output

setting.name: Ibm UEFI Perf Mon Cfg
setting.desc: Ibm UEFI Performance Monitor Setting

setting.name: Ibm UEFI Oem Spd
setting.desc: Ibm UEFI Oem Spd Setting

config.name: Secure Boot Configuration
config.desc: Press <Enter> to select Secure Boot options.

setting.name: Secure Boot is:
setting.desc: Secure Boot Enable or Disable

config.name: iSCSI Configuration
config.desc: Configure the iSCSI parameters.

setting.name: iSCSI Initiator Name
setting.desc: The worldwide unique name of iSCSI Initiator. Only IQN format is accepted.

setting.name: Mac Address
setting.desc: The attempt MAC address should be one of the availabe MAC addresses.

setting.name: iSCSI Attempt Name
setting.desc: The human name defined for this attempt.

setting.name: iSCSI Attempt Boot Mode
setting.desc: Select Boot Mode for the iSCSI Attempt. For legacy iSCSI boot mode, ethernet port should also be properly enabled or disabled.

setting.name: iSCSI Mode
setting.desc: Disabled, Enabled, Enabled for MPIO. Please make sure all necessary items(e.g., initiator IP, target IP and authentication settings) been set appropriately before enable this item. Otherwise, this attempt may be lost after reboot.

setting.name: Internet Protocol
setting.desc: Initiator IP address is system assigned in IP6 mode. In Autoconfigure mode, iSCSI driver will attempt to connect iSCSI target via IPv4 stack, if failed then attempt IPv6 stack.

setting.name: Connection Retry Count
setting.desc: The minimum value is 0 and the maximum is 16. 0 means no retry.

setting.name: Connection Establishing Timeout
setting.desc: The timeout value in milliseconds. The minimum value is 100 milliseconds and the maximum is 20 seconds.

setting.name: ISID
setting.desc: OUI-format ISID in 6 bytes, default value are derived from MAC address. Only last 3 bytes are configurable. Example: update 0ABBCCDDEEFF to 0ABBCCF07901 by input F07901.

setting.name: Enable DHCP
setting.desc: Enable DHCP

setting.name: Initiator IP Address
setting.desc: Enter IP address in dotted-decimal notation.

setting.name: Initiator Subnet Mask
setting.desc: Enter IP address in dotted-decimal notation.

setting.name: Gateway
setting.desc: Enter IP address in dotted-decimal notation.

setting.name: Get target info via DHCP
setting.desc: Get target info via DHCP

setting.name: Target Name
setting.desc: The worldwide unique name of the target. Only iqn. format is accepted.

setting.name: Target IP Address
setting.desc: Enter IP address in dotted-decimal notation.

setting.name: Target Port
setting.desc: Target Port

setting.name: Boot LUN
setting.desc: Hexadecimal representation of the LU number. Examples are: 4752-3A4F-6b7e-2F99, 6734-9-156f-127, 4186-9

setting.name: Authentication Type
setting.desc: Authentication method: CHAP, Kerberos, or None

setting.name: CHAP Type
setting.desc: None, One way CHAP or mutual CHAP

setting.name: CHAP Name
setting.desc: CHAP Name

setting.name: CHAP Secret
setting.desc: The minimum length is 12 bytes and the maximum length is 16 bytes.

setting.name: Reverse CHAP Name
setting.desc: Reverse CHAP Name

setting.name: Reverse CHAP Secret
setting.desc: The minimum length is 12 bytes and the maximum length is 16 bytes.

config.name: Physical Presence Policy Configuration
config.desc: Press <Enter> to select Physical Presence Policy options.

setting.name: Physical Presence Policy
setting.desc: Enabled allows features which require Physical Presence to be completed without the need for Hardware Physical Presence. Once enabled, a time-out value is used to assert the policy for a specified number of minutes. The policy needs to be enabled, with a timeout, then asserted using out of band ipmitool. NOTE: If moved to the Disabled state it will require Hardware Physical Presence to re-enable this policy.

setting.name: Minutes To Assert
setting.desc: Number of minutes (range 1-100) to have Remote Physical Presence asserted. Physical Presence Policy must be Enabled and a value set to have remote physical Presence asserted. NOTE: This is not a count down value.

config.name: Boot Manager
config.desc: This selection will allow you to change boot parameters and boot from file.

setting.name: System Boot Mode
setting.desc: Controls which drivers /option ROMs the Boot Manager uses. UEFI Mode: UEFI-aware adapters & boot loaders Legacy Mode: skips UEFI-aware drivers, & runs option ROMs to boot a legacy OS

setting.name: Optimized Boot
setting.desc: Optimized Boot will load a minimum number of drivers during boot, which results in reduced boot time. However, this may also result in boot device changes not being recognized.

setting.name: Quiet Boot
setting.desc: Disabling Quiet Boot will show system summary prior to system logo.

setting.name: Limit Boot Attempts
setting.desc: Stop Boot list retry with system reset after finite number of retries.

setting.name: Infinite Boot Attempt
setting.desc: Continuously retry the Boot Order. Please ensure a UEFI boot device(i.e. PXE) is specified in Boot Sequence.

setting.name: Ignore Legacy Flag On IPMI
setting.desc: Do not use legacy boot mode flag from IPMI boot option command and follow the system boot mode.

config.name: Boot Order
config.desc: This selection will allow you to change the boot order.

setting.name: Boot Order
setting.desc: Specify, from the list of bootable devices, the desired order in which to search for bootable media. One or more items from the list may be specified.

setting.name: Wol Boot Order
setting.desc: Specify, from the list of bootable devices, the desired order in which to search for WOL bootable media. One or more items from the list may be specified.

config.name: LSI MegaRAID Configuration Tool
config.desc: Allows you to retrieve RAID controller information and configure RAID volumes.

setting.name: UCM Data Structure Version
setting.desc: The version of the UCM data structure.

setting.name: Controller Name
setting.desc: Indicates the marketing name of the controller.a

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.desc: Indicates the version of the controller firmware.

setting.name: UEFI BSD Version
setting.desc: Indicates the version of the UEFI Boot Service Driver which manages this controller.

setting.name: Drive Count
setting.desc: Indicates the number of drives attached to this controller.

setting.name: Virtual Drive Count
setting.desc: Indicates the number of virtual drives present on this controller.

setting.name: Protection Capable
setting.desc: Indicates whether the controller supports data protection

setting.name: Protection Enabled
setting.desc: Indicates whether data protection is enabled or disabled.

setting.name: RAID Level
setting.desc: Indicates the RAID level of the virtual drive.

setting.name: Media
setting.desc: Displays the media type of the drive involved in this virtual drive.

setting.name: Interface Type
setting.desc: Displays the technology of the drive, such as SAS or SATA involved in this virtual drive.

setting.name: Drive Count
setting.desc: Indicates the number of drives used to create this virtual drive.

setting.name: Status
setting.desc: Displays the current status of the virtual drive.

setting.name: Size (KB)
setting.desc: Indicates the size of virtual drive in KB.

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: The logical sector size of this virtual drive. The possible options are 4 KB or 512 B.

setting.name: Media
setting.desc: Indicates the type of media, such as HDD or SSD.

setting.name: Interface Type
setting.desc: Indicates the technology of the drive, such as SAS or SATA.

setting.name: Size (KB)
setting.desc: Displays the size of the drive in KB.

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: The logical sector size of this drive. The possible options are 4 KB or 512 B.

setting.name: Status
setting.desc: Displays the current status of the drive.

setting.name: Protection Capable
setting.desc: Indicates whether the drive is capable of protection or not.

setting.name: Target ID of Associated Virtual Drive
setting.desc: Displays the target id of the associated virtual drive.

setting.name: Media
setting.desc: Indicates the type of media, such as HDD or SSD.

setting.name: Interface Type
setting.desc: Indicates the technology of the drive, such as SAS or SATA.

setting.name: Size (KB)
setting.desc: Displays the size of the drive in KB.

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: The logical sector size of this drive. The possible options are 4 KB or 512 B.

setting.name: Status
setting.desc: Displays the current status of the drive.

setting.name: Protection Capable
setting.desc: Indicates whether the drive is capable of protection or not.

setting.name: Target ID of Associated Virtual Drive
setting.desc: Displays the target id of the associated virtual drive.

setting.desc: Indicates the type of media, such as HDD or SSD.

setting.name: Interface Type
setting.desc: Indicates the technology of the drive, such as SAS or SATA.

setting.name: Size (KB)
setting.desc: Displays the size of the drive in KB.

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: The logical sector size of this drive. The possible options are 4 KB or 512 B.

setting.desc: Indicates whether the drive is capable of protection or not.

setting.name: Size (KB)

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: The logical sector size of this drive. The possible options are 4 KB or 512 B.

setting.name: Protection Capable

setting.name: Target ID of Associated Virtual Drive
setting.desc: Displays the target id of the associated virtual drive.

setting.name: Media
setting.desc: Indicates the type of media, such as HDD or SSD.

setting.name: Interface Type
setting.desc: Indicates the technology of the drive, such as SAS or SATA.

setting.name: Size (KB)
setting.desc: Displays the size of the drive in KB.

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: The logical sector size of this drive. The possible options are 4 KB or 512 B.

setting.name: Status
setting.desc: Displays the current status of the drive.

setting.name: Protection Capable
setting.desc: Indicates whether the drive is capable of protection or not.

setting.name: Target ID of Associated Virtual Drive
setting.desc: Displays the target id of the associated virtual drive.

setting.name: Media
setting.desc: Indicates the type of media, such as HDD or SSD.

setting.name: Interface Type
setting.desc: Indicates the technology of the drive, such as SAS or SATA.

setting.name: Size (KB)
setting.desc: Displays the size of the drive in KB.

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: The logical sector size of this drive. The possible options are 4 KB or 512 B.

setting.name: Status
setting.desc: Displays the current status of the drive.

setting.name: Protection Capable
setting.desc: Indicates whether the drive is capable of protection or not.

setting.name: Target ID of Associated Virtual Drive
setting.desc: Displays the target id of the associated virtual drive.

setting.name: Media
setting.desc: Indicates the type of media, such as HDD or SSD.

setting.name: Interface Type
setting.desc: Indicates the technology of the drive, such as SAS or SATA.

setting.name: Size (KB)
setting.desc: Displays the size of the drive in KB.

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: The logical sector size of this drive. The possible options are 4 KB or 512 B.

setting.name: Status
setting.desc: Displays the current status of the drive.

setting.name: Protection Capable
setting.desc: Indicates whether the drive is capable of protection or not.

setting.name: Target ID of Associated Virtual Drive
setting.desc: Displays the target id of the associated virtual drive.

setting.name: UCM Data Structure Version
setting.desc: The version of the UCM data structure.

setting.name: Clear Configuration
setting.desc: Clear Configuration

setting.name: RAID Level
setting.desc:
Selects the desired RAID level. The RAID levels that can be configured are 0, 1, 5, and 10.
RAID 0 -- uses drive striping to provide high data throughput, especially for large files in an environment that requires no data redundancy.
RAID 1 -- uses drive mirroring so that data written to one drive is simultaneously written to another drive. RAID 1 is good for small databases or other applications that require small capacity and complete data redundancy.
RAID 5 -- uses drive striping and parity data across all drives (distributed parity) to provide high data throughput and data redundancy, especially for small random access.
RAID 10 -- is a combination of RAID 0 and RAID 1, uses drive striping across mirrored drives. It provides high data throughput and complete data redundancy. RAID 10 can support up to eight spans, and up to 32 drives per span.

setting.name: Drive Count
setting.desc: Indicates the number of drives that need to be used to create virtual drive.

setting.name: Media
setting.desc: Indicates the type of media that need to be used to create virtual drive.

setting.name: Interface Type
setting.desc: Indicates the type of drive technology that need to be used to create virtual drive.

setting.name: Logical Sector Size
setting.desc: Indicates the logical sector size of the drive that need to be used to create virtual drive.

setting.name: Protect Virtual Drive
setting.desc: Allows you to create a protected virtual drive. Virtual drives can only be selected for protection at the time of creation and not anytime after. If the Protect Virtual Drive checkbox is not selected, the resultant virtual drive is not protected.

setting.name: UCM Data Structure Version
setting.desc: The version of the UCM data structure.

setting.name: Operation
setting.desc: Allow user to choose whether to save the configuration or to restore the configuration.

setting.name: Exclude System PD(s)
setting.desc: Allow user to exclude the system PD(s) during restore.

config.name: Intel(R) I350 Gigabit Network Connection - 6C:0B:84:B7:E0:26
config.desc: Configure Gigabit Ethernet device parameters

setting.name: Blink LEDs
setting.desc: Identify the physical network port by blinking the associated LED.

setting.name: Link Status
setting.desc: Link Status

setting.name: Virtual MAC Address
setting.desc: Programmatically assignable MAC address for port.

setting.name: Link Speed
setting.desc: Specifies the port speed used for the selected boot protocol.

setting.name: Wake On LAN
setting.desc: Enables the server to be powered on using an in-band magic packet.
